result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony W Sleaper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 1 day time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center, and referral to the Benedict Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.
Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, and comply with any recommended treatment.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00.
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA).

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony W Sleaper

records.addlTxt: Order for Ignition Interlock Exemption, signed and filed.

Defendant Anthony W Sleaper in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Anthony W Sleaper.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center, and referral to the Benedict Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. 

-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.  
-Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 24 months on any vehicle owned, operated, and titled in the defendant's name.
-Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, and comply with any recommended treatment.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Letter to the court regarding sentencing, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.
Affidavit in Support of Order Exempting Vehicle from IID Requirement

Defendant Anthony W Sleaper in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Court ordered defendant to follow all conditions of bail as previously ordered.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony W Sleaper in court with Attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.

Arraignment held.
Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 
Defense counsel requests adjournment for scheduling.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Anthony W Sleaper in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 1p
